_comment: Created by rreed on 25/05/2017 13:34:17 using v2.7
title: How have the numbers of nurses in psychiatric services changed?
analysis_commentary:
There has been a steady decline in the number of non-community psychiatric nurses (other psychiatry) between September 2009 and January 2017, from 25,341 to 19,340; this represents a 24% decrease. The number of community psychiatric nurses has remained steady, though has been increasing gradually since April 2016, standing at 16,505 in January 2017.

Updated April 2017.
